attributes.action: Introduce an international fair pricing law to stop companies charging UK citizens twice as much as other international residents for the same product.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It seems that in the UK we have to pay more than everyone else to buy the same things that people buy in other countries.  Some recent examples of this would be the sale of Windows Vista, the Xbox 360, and (when it eventually goes on sale) the Playstation 3.  I propose that the government should introduce laws to force international corporations to charge UK citizens a fair price where the product being sold is the same (or inferior to in the case of the PS3) in different countries.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
